title: Firefox prevented this site from opening a pop-up window
content:
Firefox prevented a pop-up window. Application should open a new window when user click on a "Start Meeting" feature.

I tried with Permissions > Block pop-up window exception and it works. What about other customers which is using this application? They would think that application is not working properly? Is there any workaround to overcome this problem with pop-up window blocking? Or is the only solution that every user of the application must approve an exception before using the application which is very impractical?

Best regards, Dejan

title: Is there any config to accept getDisplayMedia without user gesture ?
content: I'm using firefox as headless browser with selenium. Now I want to use getDisplayMedia() but I get this error message : getDisplayMedia must be called from a user gesture handler. Is there any way ( about:config or start ff with some flag ) that allow me to use getDisplayMedia without user gesture ?
creator: vienntbna

title: Firefox tab crashes on a specific website
content:
Hi,

i am having a rather weird and persistent issue. When I try to open a specific website, namely www.westend61.de, this Firefox tab crashes, as seen in the provided screenshot. With a normal website this wouldn't bother me so much, but this page is the main page of the company I work for, and therefore I and potential customers must be able to reach it. That being said, this does not necessarily have to be a Firefox problem, the issue could also be on the server side. But the website works on other computers, other operating systems and other browsers. As far as I know, the website works fine, this computer using this browser being the only exception. I worked my way through the Firefox support page: 

- checked for newer firefox version - checked for newer compatible MacOS version - checked for newer graphics driver - disabled all firewall, anti virus software - started firefox in Safe Mode - reinstalled firefox & deleted all profile data - disabled hardware acceleration - set webgl.disabled to true - again safe mode

The tab crashes every time. This computer is an old End 2013 iMac running Catalina and the newest Firefox. - More information can be found in the troubleshooting information and the crash report: 97386afb-99eb-4102-ab4f-3947b0210521

Thank you very much.
creator: administrator20

title: Firefox Browser won't respond anymore
content:
My browser won't respond anymore. The only thing I can think of is that I turned off Windows Defender for a few minutes and then turned it back on.

I then turned off and closed my laptop. When I came back to turn it on, nothing will load anymore. Google Chrome works normally. But Firefox won't load anything and nothing is responsive. I didn't have an account until now and I don't want to lose all my bookmarks and browser history :(.

I tried messing with the Windows Defender Firewall as it said in the articles but nothing worked. I'm not even sure if I made it worse.

Before, on "Allowed Apps to communicate through Windows Defender Firewall" there were only Firefox and Firefox( C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox) but now there are 2 Firefoxes.

The first Firefox is checked only for Private The second Firefox is checked only for Public And the Third Firefox( C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox) is checked for both Private and Public.

I don't know what to do. I don't want to lose my information :(
creator: giodude.15

title: Bit.ly links
content:
I am having huge difficulty connecting to bit.ly links on Firefox for Mac. I get the error message:

I have no issues accessing the links on Chrome or Safari.

title: How to fix Firefox freeze after clicking "Save Image As" from dropdown context menu?
content: The Firefox process seems to freeze after "mouse button up" from "Save Image As". Sometimes the context menu stays frozen on the screen, sometimes it does not. There is no ability to switch tabs or cancel the context menu. The image itself never saves to disk. I have reformatted and installed Firefox several times fresh out of the box and it still has this behavior. Running Firefox from the console and having Firefox freeze gives no indication or error or message about what is going on. I would say this happens 1 out of 20 images saved. I can easily reproduce this behavior, even though it is inconsistent.
creator: biggestsonicfan

title: Partes de firefox estan tanto en ingles como en español

Y si antes de que haya duda, he revisado las configuraciones de idioma y están configuradas en el español regional de mexico.

title: changing font size of bookmarks menu
content:
I am a 74 y.o. not very computer literate. Eyesight is failing with age,must be lots of other Firefox users in this same boat. Bookmarks menu does not resize according to page font size. Keeping in mind that I am a Dinosaur and do NOT understand P.C. Tech speak. I really need detailed easy to understand directions on how to resize the bookmarks menu. 

Maybe this would be a good upgrade for Firefox so all of us elders could use Firefox more easily.

I hope this is possible to do. If this is not an easy fix I at least want to thank you all for helping to make Firefox a very good browser.
creator: bmckinney611
